page.title: 01INTRO TO EDDERTON.
page.content: {Edderton}is a small, sleepy village in the Highland Region lying between the foot of the Struie Hill and the edge of the Dornoch Firth 70 kilometres north of Inverness.The name Edderton means mid-town. There is a population of approximately 340,most of whom are very friendly.In the centre of Edderton there are approximately 40 houses and 40 more scattered about, up to a radius of five kilometres. Near the middle of the village there is an unusual{Standing Stone}on which there are symbols thought to be Pictish .Not far from the stone there is a{Bronze Age Burial Site}. You will find Scotland's second oldest{Distillery}in Edderton.There are two{Churches,}a{Hall,}a{School}and a small{Shop/Post Office}combined.
